briefdescription.para: Checks whether the emulated three-button LCD has already been initialized.

simplesect.para: True if the LCD has been initialized or false if not.

briefdescription.para: Creates an emulation of the three-button, UART-based VEX LCD on the display.

simplesect.para: True if the LCD was successfully initialized, or false if it has already been initialized.

briefdescription.para: Turns off the Legacy LCD Emulator.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function will clear the entire display, and you will not be able to call any further LLEMU functions until another call to lcd_initialize.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Displays a formatted string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]
Optional list of arguments for the format string

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Displays a string on the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

parameterdescription.para: The line on which to display the text [0-7]

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Clears the contents of the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Clears the contents of a line of the emulated three-button LCD screen.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first. EINVAL - The line number specified is not in the range [0-7]

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the leftmost button.

detaileddescription.para: When the leftmost button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the center button.

detaileddescription.para: When the center button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Registers a callback function for the rightmost button.

detaileddescription.para: When the rightmost button on the emulated three-button LCD is pressed, the user-provided callback function will be invoked.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The LCD has not been initialized. Call lcd_initialize() first.

parameterdescription.para: A callback function of type lcd_btn_cb_fn_t (void (*cb)(void))

simplesect.para: True if the operation was successful, or false otherwise, setting errno values as specified above.

briefdescription.para: Gets the button status from the emulated three-button LCD.

detaileddescription.para: The value returned is a 3-bit integer where 1 0 0 indicates the left button is pressed, 0 1 0 indicates the center button is pressed, and 0 0 1 indicates the right button is pressed. 0 is returned if no buttons are currently being pressed.
Note that this function is provided for legacy API compatibility purposes, with the caveat that the V5 touch screen does not actually support pressing multiple points on the screen at the same time.

simplesect.para: The buttons pressed as a bit mask

briefdescription.para: Changes the color of the LCD background to a provided color expressed in type lv_color_t.
Changes the text color of the LCD to a provided color expressed in type lv_color_t.
Clears the vision sensor LED color, reseting it back to its default behavior, displaying the most prominent object signature color.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (const int32_t id, const int32_t u_min, const int32_t u_max, const int32_t u_mean, const int32_t v_min, const int32_t v_max, const int32_t v_mean, const float range, const int32_t type)
memberdef.name: vision_signature_from_utility

briefdescription.para: Creates a signature from the vision sensor utility.

simplesect.para: A vision_signature_s_t that can be set using vision_set_signature

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t sig_id1, const uint32_t sig_id2, const uint32_t sig_id3, const uint32_t sig_id4, const uint32_t sig_id5)
memberdef.name: vision_create_color_code

briefdescription.para: Creates a color code that represents a combination of the given signature IDs.

detaileddescription.para: If fewer than 5 signatures are to be a part of the color code, pass 0 for the additional function parameters.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: EINVAL - Fewer than two signatures have been provided or one of the signatures is out of its [1-7] range (or 0 when omitted).

parameterdescription.para: The first signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The second signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The third signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The fourth signature id [1-7] to add to the color code
The fifth signature id [1-7] to add to the color code

simplesect.para: A vision_color_code_t object containing the color code information.

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects. EHOSTDOWN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given size id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const uint32_t sig_id)
memberdef.name: vision_get_by_sig

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object of the given signature according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EINVAL - sig_id is outside the range [1-8] EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects. EAGAIN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The signature ID [1-7] for which an object will be returned.

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given signature and size_id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const vision_color_code_t color_code)
memberdef.name: vision_get_by_code

briefdescription.para: Gets the nth largest object of the given color code according to size_id.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EAGAIN - Reading the vision sensor failed for an unknown reason.

parameterdescription.para: The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The vision_color_code_t for which an object will be returned

simplesect.para: The vision_object_s_t object corresponding to the given color code and size_id, or PROS_ERR if an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Gets the exposure parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/vision.html#exposure-setting for more detials.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

simplesect.para: The current exposure setting from [0,150], PROS_ERR if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of objects currently detected by the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

simplesect.para: The number of objects detected on the specified vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid or an error occurred.

briefdescription.para: Get the white balance parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

simplesect.para: The current RGB white balance setting of the sensor

briefdescription.para: Prints the contents of the signature as an initializer list to the terminal.

parameterdescription.para: The signature for which the contents will be printed

simplesect.para: 1 if no errors occured, PROS_ERR otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const uint32_t object_count, vision_object_s_t *const object_arr)
memberdef.name: vision_read_by_size

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects.

parameterdescription.para: The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The number of objects to read
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const uint32_t sig_id, const uint32_t object_count, vision_object_s_t *const object_arr)
memberdef.name: vision_read_by_sig

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EDOM - size_id is greater than the number of available objects.

parameterdescription.para: The number of objects to read
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The signature ID [1-7] for which objects will be returned.
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint32_t size_id, const vision_color_code_t color_code, const uint32_t object_count, vision_object_s_t *const object_arr)
memberdef.name: vision_read_by_code

briefdescription.para: Reads up to object_count object descriptors into object_arr.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21), or fewer than object_count number of objects were found. ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The number of objects to read
The object to read from a list roughly ordered by object size (0 is the largest item, 1 is the second largest, etc.)
The vision_color_code_t for which objects will be returned
A pointer to copy the objects into

simplesect.para: The number of object signatures copied. This number will be less than object_count if there are fewer objects detected by the vision sensor. Returns PROS_ERR if the port was invalid, an error occurred, or fewer objects than size_id were found. All objects in object_arr that were not found are given VISION_OBJECT_ERR_SIG as their signature.

briefdescription.para: Gets the object detection signature with the given id number.

simplesect.para: A vision_signature_s_t containing information about the signature.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const uint8_t signature_id, vision_signature_s_t *const signature_ptr)
memberdef.name: vision_set_signature

briefdescription.para: Stores the supplied object detection signature onto the vision sensor.

simplesect.para: This saves the signature in volatile memory, and the signature will be lost as soon as the sensor is powered down.

parameterdescription.para: The signature id to store into
A pointer to the signature to save

simplesect.para: 1 if no errors occured, PROS_ERR otherwise

briefdescription.para: Enables/disables auto white-balancing on the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor EINVAL - enable was not 0 or 1

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the exposure parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: See https://pros.cs.purdue.edu/v5/tutorials/topical/vision.html#exposure-setting for more detials.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the vision sensor LED color, overriding the automatic behavior.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: An RGB code to set the LED to

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the white balance parameter of the Vision Sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: The new RGB white balance setting of the sensor

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the (0,0) coordinate for the Field of View.

detaileddescription.para: This will affect the coordinates returned for each request for a vision_object_s_t from the sensor, so it is recommended that this function only be used to configure the sensor at the beginning of its use.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a vision sensor

parameterdescription.para: One of vision_zero_e_t to set the (0,0) coordinate for the FOV

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the Wi-Fi mode of the Vision sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This functions uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given port is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21) EACCESS - Anothe resources is currently trying to access the port

parameterdescription.para: Disable Wi-Fi on the Vision sensor if 0, enable otherwise (e.g. 1)

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to make motors move

briefdescription.para: Sets the voltage for the motor from -127 to 127.

detaileddescription.para: This is designed to map easily to the input from the controller's analog stick for simple opcontrol use. The actual behavior of the motor is analogous to use of motor_move_voltage(), or motorSet() from the PROS 2 API.

This function will not respect brake modes, and simply sets the voltage to the desired value.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The new motor voltage from -127 to 127

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Stops the motor using the currently configured brake mode.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets motor velocity to zero, which will cause it to act according to the set brake mode. If brake mode is set to MOTOR_BRAKE_HOLD, this function may behave differently than calling motor_move_absolute(port, 0) or motor_move_relative(port, 0).
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const double position, const int32_t velocity)
memberdef.name: motor_move_absolute

briefdescription.para: Sets the target absolute position for the motor to move to.

detaileddescription.para: This movement is relative to the position of the motor when initialized or the position when it was most recently reset with motor_set_zero_position().

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes. The example code shows how to block until a movement is finished.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The absolute position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t port, const double position, const int32_t velocity)
memberdef.name: motor_move_relative

briefdescription.para: Sets the relative target position for the motor to move to.

detaileddescription.para: This movement is relative to the current position of the motor as given in motor_get_position(). Providing 10.0 as the position parameter would result in the motor moving clockwise 10 units, no matter what the current position is.

This function simply sets the target for the motor, it does not block program execution until the movement finishes. The example code shows how to block until a movement is finished.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The relative position to move to in the motor's encoder units
The maximum allowable velocity for the movement in RPM

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the velocity for the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This velocity corresponds to different actual speeds depending on the gearset used for the motor. This results in a range of +-100 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_36, +-200 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_18, and +-600 for E_MOTOR_GEARSET_6. The velocity is held with PID to ensure consistent speed, as opposed to setting the motor's voltage.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The new motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Sets the output voltage for the motor from -12000 to 12000 in millivolts.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: This function will not respect brake modes, and simply sets the voltage to the desired value.

parameterdescription.para: The new voltage value from -12000 to 12000

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Changes the output velocity for a profiled movement (motor_move_absolute or motor_move_relative).

detaileddescription.para: This will have no effect if the motor is not following a profiled movement.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: The new motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600 depending on the motor's gearset

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the target position set for the motor by the user.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The target position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the velocity commanded to the motor by the user.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The commanded motor velocity from +-100, +-200, or +-600, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

description.para: These functions allow programmers to collect telemetry from motors

briefdescription.para: Gets the actual velocity of the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's actual velocity in RPM or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current drawn by the motor in mA.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's current in mA or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the direction of movement for the motor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 for moving in the positive direction, -1 for moving in the negative direction, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the efficiency of the motor in percent.

detaileddescription.para: An efficiency of 100% means that the motor is moving electrically while drawing no electrical power, and an efficiency of 0% means that the motor is drawing power but not moving.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's efficiency in percent or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is drawing over its current limit.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 if the motor's current limit is being exceeded and 0 if the current limit is not exceeded, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor's temperature is above its limit.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: 1 if the temperature limit is exceeded and 0 if the the temperature is below the limit, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is stopped.

simplesect.para: Although this function forwards data from the motor, the motor presently does not provide any value. This function returns PROS_ERR with errno set to ENOSYS.
1 if the motor is not moving, 0 if the motor is moving, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno

briefdescription.para: Checks if the motor is at its zero position.

simplesect.para: Although this function forwards data from the motor, the motor presently does not provide any value. This function returns PROS_ERR with errno set to ENOSYS.
1 if the motor is at zero absolute position, 0 if the motor has moved from its absolute zero, or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno

briefdescription.para: The width of the Vision Sensor’s field of view.
The height of the Vision Sensor’s field of view.
This structure contains the parameters used by the Vision Sensor to detect objects.

detaileddescription.para: This structure contains a descriptor of an object detected by the Vision Sensor.

briefdescription.para: This structure contains the parameters used by the Vision Sensor to detect objects.

detaileddescription.para: This structure contains a descriptor of an object detected by the Vision Sensor.

briefdescription.para: This structure contains the parameters used by the Vision Sensor to detect objects.

detaileddescription.para: This structure contains a descriptor of an object detected by the Vision Sensor.

briefdescription.para: This enumeration defines the different types of objects that can be detected by the Vision Sensor.
This enumeration defines different zero points for returned vision objects.
Color codes are just signatures with multiple IDs and a different type.
Enumerated Values.
Gets the faults experienced by the motor.

detaileddescription.para: Compare this bitfield to the bitmasks in motor_fault_e_t.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: A bitfield containing the motor's faults.

briefdescription.para: Gets the flags set by the motor's operation.

detaileddescription.para: Compare this bitfield to the bitmasks in motor_flag_e_t.
This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: A bitfield containing the motor's flags.

briefdescription.para: Gets the raw encoder count of the motor at a given timestamp.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a time in milliseconds for which the encoder count will be returned. If NULL, the timestamp at which the encoder count was read will not be supplied

simplesect.para: The raw encoder count at the given timestamp or PROS_ERR if the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Gets the absolute position of the motor in its encoder units.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's absolute position in its encoder units or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the power drawn by the motor in Watts.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's power draw in Watts or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the temperature of the motor in degrees Celsius.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's temperature in degrees Celsius or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the torque generated by the motor in Newton Meters (Nm).

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's torque in Nm or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Gets the voltage delivered to the motor in millivolts.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as a motor

simplesect.para: The motor's voltage in mV or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color hue.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Hue has a range of 0 to 359.999

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: hue value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color saturation.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Saturation has a range of 0 to 1.0

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: saturation value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected color brightness.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. Brightness has a range of 0 to 1.0

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: brightness value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR_F if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the detected proximity value.

detaileddescription.para: This is not available if gestures are being detected. proximity has a range of 0 to 255.

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: poximity value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Set the pwm value of the White LED.

detaileddescription.para: value that ranges from 0 to 100

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation is successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the pwm value of the White LED.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: LED pwm value that ranges from 0 to 100 if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the processed RGBC data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: rgb value if the operation was successful or an optical_rgb_s_t with all fields set to PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the raw, unprocessed RGBC data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: raw rgb value if the operation was successful or an optical_raw_s_t with all fields set to PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the most recent gesture data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: Gestures will be cleared after 500mS

This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: gesture value if the operation was successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Get the most recent raw gesture data from the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: gesture value if the operation was successful or an optical_gesture_s_t with all fields set to PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Enable gesture detection on the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation is successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.

briefdescription.para: Disable gesture detection on the sensor.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses the following values of errno when an error state is reached: ENXIO - The given value is not within the range of V5 ports (1-21). ENODEV - The port cannot be configured as an Optical Sensor

parameterdescription.para: The V5 Optical Sensor port number from 1-21

simplesect.para: 1 if the operation is successful or PROS_ERR if the operation failed, setting errno.
